isNonBlankString

public static boolean isNonBlankString(java.lang.String text)
Tests if a string is a non-null, non-empty string. This can be called to determine if the string should be displayed, or not.

Parameters:
text - String to test.
Returns:
If text is null, returns false.
If text is an empty string (""), returns false.
Else returns true.

isBlankOrNull

public static boolean isBlankOrNull(java.lang.String text)
Tests if a string is a blank string, or is null. This can be called to determine if the string should be displayed, or not.

This is exactly the opposite result to isNonBlankString(String).

Parameters:
text - String to test.
Returns:
If text is null, returns true.
If text is an empty string (""), returns true.
Else returns null.
See Also:
isNonBlankString(String)

isValidPhoneNumber

public static boolean isValidPhoneNumber(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
Validates a phone number string

Parameters:
phoneNumber - input phone number String
Returns:
true if the phone number is in a valid format, otherwise false
